titlestmt.author: compiled by Carol King, and Nancy Lyon and staff of Manuscripts and Archives

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 10:50

did.unittitle: Angola collection

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence, printed material, flags, and photographs relating to the history of Angola and the current political, economic, and social conditions.

langmaterial.language: The materials are in English, French, and Portuguese.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred from the African Collection Curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Angola Collection (MS 1502). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: African Collection (MS 605); African Postcard Collection (MS 1575). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by accession.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, printed material, flags, and photographs relating to the history of Angola and the current political, economic, and social conditions.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

controlaccess.persname: Govea, Augustus E. B. (Augustus Edward Bothelho), approximately 1826-1890
controlaccess.corpname: Unióao Nacional para a Independæencia Total de Angola

did.unittitle: Original Accession
Augustus E. B. Govea
Correspondence concerning trading/shipping company in Luanda
Invoices regarding trade and shipping
Letter from George M. Houser, describing his trip to French Equatorial Africa, including a visit to Dr. Albert Schweitzer's hospital and to numerous missions

unittitle.title: Relatorio da Actividade de Vasco Valdez, Missão de Biologia Maritima

did.unittitle: Angolan liberation: pamphlets; journals; documents printed in the United States
"Liberté [et Terre]": printed material published by La Mission du Caire du Gouvernement Révolutionnaire de l'Angola en Exil (GRAE)
National Union for the Total Independence of Angola (UNITA): communiques; papers; documents
Angolan liberation: pamphlets; journals; documents printed internationally
"A Voz Democratica de Angola P. D. A.": monthly information bulletin of the Angolan Democratic Party
Agostinho Neto, Antonio, "Sobre a literatura": discourse for the Instituto Nacional do Livro e do Disco (INALD)
Angolan government information journals
Angolan women's movement
Agencia Angola Press (ANGOP): news bulletins
"Africa confidencial"
"Kwacha News" and other material from the Free Angola Information Service
"Angola Today" and other material from the Free Angola Campaign
"Angola Comment": Catholic Institute for International Relations (CIIR)
"Serviços bibliográficos da Livraria Portugal"
"Correio da semana: semanário de informação geral"
Direcção dos Caminhos de Ferro de Loanda, Caminho de Ferro de Malange: photographs
Additional Material
Movimento Popular de Libertação de Angola (MPLA-Partido do Trabalho): "Programa E Estatutos"
Partido Angolano Conservador da Identidade Africana (PACIA): "Manifesto"

unittitle.title: D.S.O.P.: Repartição Provincial de Benguela Secção Das Estradas Adjuvantes Ad C.F.B.: Relatorio

did.unittitle: Additional Material
Ad Hoc Coalition for a New Foreign Policy [formerly the Coalition to Stop Funding the War, informational fliers]
The Africa Fund [Angola information packet and fliers]
"Africa News" [possible radio broadcasts on the Angolan civil war]
African Agenda [a voice of Afro-American opinion, vol. 5, no.1]
African National Congress, "Report: Commission of Inquiry into Recent Developments in the People's Republic of Angola" [two copies]
African Youth Movement for Liberation and Unity [newsletter, vol. 2, nos. 8-9]
Agencia Angola Press [ANGOP]
America [publication of the Jesuits of the United States and Canada, vol. 134, no. 14]
American Angolan Public Affairs Council [press releases and fliers]
American Committee on Africa [statement opposing U.S. intervention in Angola]
American Friends Service Committee [newsletter about daily life in Luanda written by Carole Collins]
Americans for Democratic Action [press releases and informational fliers on secret arms shipments to pro-Western forces in Angola]
Angola News [nos. 22-24]
Angola Newsletter [publication of United Students for the Liberation of Angola and Southern Africa, vol. 1, no.1]
Angola Peace Fund [APF]
APF Speaks... [a periodical of the Angola Peace Fund]
"A policy statement"
Angola Peace Monitor [published by ACTSA on behalf of the Angola Emergency Campaign, vol. II, no. 1-vol. III, no. 5]
Angola Solidarity Committee News [nos. 6 and 9]
Angola: the Possible Peace [published by the Catholic Institute for International Relations]
Angola Update [newsletter]
Angolan peace process [several documents and statements]
Association of Concerned African Scholars [press release opposing U.S. aid to UNITA]
Campaign for Democratic Foreign Policy [campaign goals and fliers]
Center for National Security Studies, Washington, D.C.
"Angola: Reagan's Covert Action Policy VI"
Intelligence Report [vol. 1, no. 1]
Chicago Committee for the Liberation of Angola, Mozambique and Guinea [includes "Angola Alert," nos. 2 and 4, and related materials]
CIA [notes and brief reports on Angola]
Coalition for a New Foreign and Military Policy
"Campaign against U.S. Intervention" [legislative update]
News clippings [on US intervention in Angola]
"Common Cause on Angola"
Conference on Angola [notes from speeches made at conference held at Gustavus Adolphus College in St. Peter, Minnesota]
Congressional Black Caucus [press release demanding end to U.S. Angola intervention]
The Conservative Caucus, Inc., "Background Information on Angola"
Cox, Courtland, "The American Involvement in Angola" [paper prepared for the National Black Coalition Against U.S. Involvement in Angola and Southern Africa]
Embassy of the Republic of Angola in the United Kingdom [fliers and a press release on meeting of the chiefs of general staff of the Angolan Armed Forces and Unita's military forces]
European Parliamentarians for (Southern) Africa [election observers]
Fenton Communications, Inc., "Jonas Savimbi: The Truth Behind the Myth: Agent of Democracy--or Apartheid?"
Friends of Angola, "Russia and the U.S.--Partners in Imperialism" [flier]
The Heritage Foundation
"Angola Tests the Reagan Doctrine" [paper in "The Heritage Foundation Backgrounder"]
"The Coming Winds of Democracy in Angola" [The Heritage Lectures, speech by Jonas Savimbi]
International Commission of Enquiry on Mercenaries [a special report on the trial of mercenaries, Luanda, Angola]
International Freedom Foundation, "Angola Peace Monitor" [vol. 3, no. 4]
Institute for Policy Studies, IPS Transnational Link [no.13]
MPLA Solidarity Committee [different issues of "Angola Weekly Summary," and other fliers]
Parti Democratique de l'Angola (P.D.A)
A voz Democratica de Angola [information bulletin]
Mondo a Voz Democratica de Angola
Patrice Lumumba Coalition [announcing a fundraising program for reconstruction of Angola called Um So Povo]
"Peace Accords for Angola" [prepared with mediation by the Portuguese government]
Peoples' Movement for the Liberation of Angola (MPLA)
Interview with Dr. Americo Boavida [director of medical assistance services of MPLA]
Interview with the MPLA delegation to the United Nations
People's Republic of Angola [proclamation of the independence of the People's Republic of Angola]
Permanent Mission of the People's Republic of Angola to the United Nations
"Angola- today and for ever"
Letter from President Joseph Eduardo Dos Santos to U.N. Security Council and other news extracts
Press release and news extracts
Statement by Ambassador Manuel Pedro Pacavira
"Portugal Mainland and Overseas" [fact sheet produced by the Overseas Companies of Portugal]
Rainbow Lobby [Washington, D.C]
"The Revolt of the Voiceless" [article translated from Africa , Lisbon]
Toronto Committee for the Liberation of Southern Africa, "Angola and After" [article by John Saul]
Transafrica: The Black American Lobby for Africa and the Caribbean [newsletter]
"Reagan Requests Repeal of Clark Amendment: Threatens U.S. Objectives in Southern Africa and Relations with other African Countries [news release]
"House and Senate Differ on U.S. Covert Activities in Angola" [news release]
UAW International Executive Board, "Resolution on Angola"
United States. Congress
Committee on Foreign Affairs [statements and proposals in support of increased US role in Angola]
House Subcommittee on African Affairs [background material and press conference on Angola peace negotiations and U.S. policy]
Members of Congress for Peace through Law
Proposed bills to control chemicals used in warfare
Representatives' position statements on the Angolan situation
Testimonies, speeches and statements regarding U.S. policy in Angola [position statement on Southern Africa and the Clark Amendment]
United States. Department of Justice [various acts concerning Foreign Agents Registration, Political Propaganda, etc.]
Unites States. Department of State [notes, reports and press statements on U.S. interests and concerns in Angola]
U.S. Labor Party [public statements opposing U.S. involvement in Angola]
U.S. policy in Angola [papers and testimony submitted to the subcommittee on African Affairs]
U.S. White House Office [briefings, letters, memos, and press conferences on U.S. policy in Angola]
The Washington Office on Africa [fliers and position papers concerning U.S. intervention in Angola]
did.unitdate: 1981 Feb, Apr, May, Sep, Oct, 1987, undated

Kwacha News [the official newsletter of the Free Angola Information Service]
